website_summaries.verdict: A good jack that reliably lifts a lot of weight.
pros: Can hold a decent amount of weight at 20 tons
cons: Some customers have had problems with the jack leaking

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions to bleed out any air, and there was none. Put under my 15,000 pound trailer and it lifted no sweat. It is a heavy rated jack so it does go up slowly as expected. Yes when it comes down it stop where ever weight is no longer on it pushing down, so you have to manually finish it. Great product larger button head and larger base make it sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: T-Way

customer_reviews.title: It's small...
customer_reviews.text: I agree with a few other reviewers about the jack part not wanting to go down. I didn't think I would have to open the hydraulic reservoir to release air in the fluid after a few uses but when you're steadily pumping the handle and the jack isn't lifting anymore, you have to. Also I just thought it would be a little bigger, but that's my fault. I didn't read the product dimensions before hand. I don't have huge hands either. All my work gloves are in a size Large.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Davis

customer_reviews.title: Waste of $$$
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to use these on a Mitsubishi. A car that isn't exactly high off the ground. These barely fit underneath the car. Even when I could get them placed and began to raise them they reached the top before even beginning to lift the car. Completely useless, and now I cannot return them.
customer_reviews.author: Modern Day Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: No Screw Adjuster. Pump Handles Must Be Assembled/Disassembled with Bolts
customer_reviews.text: This review is for a 50-ton jack. Seems like a decent jack, for the price. Bolts must be used to connect/disconnect the three-piece pump handle. This is inappropriate because, in normal operation, one lifts the jack to the load with just one section of the handle then adds the other sections as leverage is needed. Most jack handles assemble with convenient spring clips, saving a lot of time. Given the short throw of the piston, a standard screw adjuster in the top of the piston is needed so the operator does not need to stack blocks under the jack.
customer_reviews.author: Edmund Kellogg Clark

customer_reviews.title: Crappy 6  Ton Jack
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this 6 ton jack for a month or so on general ranch work. I have found it to be very poorly made, tipical China, so what more could I expect. The most troublesome was the haudrylic fluid leakage around the bleed-down screw each time the jack was lowered. The fluid stained my shop floor and I don't like that. It will forever remind me what a crappy jack that I bought. Secondly, when the bleed-down screw is opened, the jack binds and will not lower under light loads. The jack is now in my junk heap waiting to be taken to the metal recycler.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mohn

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bottle Jack
customer_reviews.text: Bottle jacks are not the best way to lift a vehicle, but they are the most economical. I feel this item to be well constructed and very sturdy. I didn't want to spend the money on a floor jack so I went with this design. It has served me well on 4 projects so far. One note, when it arrived it had leaked oil due to the item being shipped on its side. I added some oil I got at Walmart and it works great, no issue. Just be sure to store in an upright position. Highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Vince G.

customer_reviews.title: One of the pins came out after the first couple of uses!
customer_reviews.text: There is a rinky dink pin that holds together the pump assembly (the part where you put the handle in to jack it), and that work its way out before we even really got a chance to put the jack to the test. Needless to say, a cotter pin and some tinkering got the jack back to where it would work again. That's the reason for the deduction of a star, I don't want to fix something not long after purchase! We don't use jacks a whole lot, why would you want too?, but when we did use this one it worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: SquarePeg

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome compact little bottle jack. This thing is a beast and works very well. I think the problems most people are having that cause them to leave bad reviews on this product come from improper storage, careless shipping, and/or improper first time use. Always store bottle jacks upright so they don’t loose fluid. Also when you use this jack for the first time make sure you follow the first time use instructions. The paperwork provides instructions to remove excess air that has formed inside the hydraulic of the jack from travel and climate/elevation changes during shipping. This air could inhibit jack function in left in place. Anyways, great jack. Would recommend and buy again. (6 ton model)
customer_reviews.author: Matt C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and appears good quality. Small.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on a Kia Sorento after I broke the scissor jack. I chose the 10-ton bottle jack in the height seems great for the purpose of changing tires / wheels on that Kia. The only other hydraulic jacks if used before were floor jacks not bottle jacks and in comparison you have to pump the lever on this many times to lift the car. It takes no muscle to lift the car just way more pumps than I would have expected. Be careful the small base does make it a bit tippy. A big bonus for this jack was it was the perfect size to fit where the scissor jack was without rattling around.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Bean

customer_reviews.title: Box arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in June as a Birthday present for my son. The box arrived damaged but when I opened it and looked inside I thought everything was there. Of course his birthday comes around and he loves it but what I did not know (being a mom) was there are supposed to be two pieces to the handle and it only had one. Of course the piece that is missing is the one that works the jack to turn the fitting to make it go up and down. Of course since I purchased this in june it is not longer returnable and to buy that piece if almost $20.00.
customer_reviews.author: DeniseR

customer_reviews.title: Great jack for cheap
customer_reviews.text: For the price this thing is pretty dang sturdy. I don’t own a truck anymore but I do find bottle jacks incredibky useful for lifting your tank or transmission when replacing parts, gaskets, mounts, etc. and you want something that will be easy to fit under your vehicle, sit still, and be able to hold a massive amount of weight. This was perfect for replacing my transmission mount which required me to lift it about 5 or 6 inches with a wooden block. I’m sure I will be using it many time in the future. Don’t forget to properly prepare the jack before using. Don’t wanna get your axles or transmission smashed... or even worse, your head.
customer_reviews.author: CDizzie

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Used to try to lift the roof of my van which was slightly concaved inward. Straight garbage, leaked oil EVERYWHERE! I honestly don't see how this could lift a car if it can't even lift a curve out of the roof of a car with nothing on it. BE CAREFUL!
customer_reviews.author: Nubian Nemesis

customer_reviews.title: It stopped lifting after one month, warranty is a joke
customer_reviews.text: It worked well... only for the first month. Now it does not lift at all. It has one year warranty. But I have to contact them repeatedly to ensure them I did not abuse it. Finally they agreed to send me a FREE seal to fix this jack. Wow, a FREE seal! But how to install this seal? You are expected to be an expert technician in order to use this jack.
customer_reviews.author: Whatscool

customer_reviews.title: A nice cheap bottle jack
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised and is easy to use. Just remember to follow the set up and bleed the air out before you use it for the first time. It's a great set for the price and does the job. The only issue is to get the jack back down you have to apply some pressure from the top. That's the easiest way. Pulling from the sides doesn't always get it down. The retraction mechanism should be a little smoother especially when you unscrew the release bolt most of the way.
customer_reviews.author: klulu

customer_reviews.title: Works well once you top off the jack oil in it.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given 5 stars, but I needed to add some jack oil right out of the box. I did bleed the air out, but it still wouldn't pump up well, or release well. It took quit a bit of jack oil to top off. After that and another bleed, it works great. It is very heavy duty, but slow to lift compared to trolley jacks. Smaller to work around or near, and easy to reposition.
customer_reviews.author: George S.

customer_reviews.title: NOT good for trucks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my 2004 f150, and while it is strong enough to lift the truck, it is WAY too short. My truck is fully stock and this thing doesn't even go up high enough to pick a single wheel off the ground without 2x4's (Not safe) For a car this would be great, but whats the point of having a jack that can lift 6 tons if its way too freakin' small to even change a tire? if your thinking about buying this for any type of truck, I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ViDominic

customer_reviews.title: Works, But Not Remarkably Well
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap & doesn't have much range. The controls are stiff and it takes a lot of pumping to move that cylinder up much. It's also quite large for it's capacity & range. In my case, mine was broken, leaking oil, and clearly had been returned as defective, only to be reshipped to me. Truly spectacularly BAD customer service & logistics on Amazon's part. They truly phoned it in on this order fulfillment. I returned the bright red monstrosity.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: A genuine piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: I jacked this thing up and could not get it to back-off. It has a really rinky-dink system for releasing the pressure. It did not function on my jack—just stuck up in the air with no where to go. It was immediately worthless.
customer_reviews.author: S. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: Jacked up the entire 2 story house to replace the jack post that were rusting out. Little hard to get the jack to retract when you release the hydraulic pressure. Have to stand on it or use a pry bar at first to get it out from under the 6x6 I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: The jacked worked great I bought it to move beams in my house ...
customer_reviews.text: The jacked worked great I bought it to move beams in my house jacked up the entire wall no problem I only gave it four stars because I think it needs air return spring on the cylinder always need to stand on it to return The cylinder back down if I need a Nother one I would definitely buy this one again
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Holding steady without sinking
customer_reviews.text: Jack arrived missing half the lever arm. Amazon sent a replacement jack a few days later. I was supposed to return the original jack but decided to go ahead and keep them both since I need two for my bus anyway. Despite some initial confusion over how this jack operates, it turned out to be a good jack. It’s been holding up a sagging corner of my bus for almost two weeks and has not sunk any noticeable amount.
customer_reviews.author: Randy F. Stallion

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Last
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this bottle jack less than two years and used it around 4 times. It’s already stopped working and I had to trash it. From the very start It would raise extremely slowly, but the final straw was it would no longer retract and drop to a closed position. I drained and replaced the hydraulic fluid but that didn’t fix it. I finally just threw it out I can’t recommend this jack at all
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Lifted My House
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to lift the center of my house (Not advised for amateurs. I'm a professional builder). It's heavy and not the easiest thing to move through a low crawlspace, and it takes a lot of pumps to raise it, but it'll lift a house with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: EMSaladin

customer_reviews.title: Worked As Intended
customer_reviews.text: It's a bottle jack. As long as it doesn't have a major flaw it's 5 stars. This one does what it's supposed to. We just used it to jack up the center of some sagging joists before sistering in new ones. It worked like you'd expect a bottle jack to work. You always run the risk of a defect but mine was solid. My floor jack is also Torin which for a few years has worked well without issue too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Green

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for a damaged shipment
customer_reviews.text: Bottle jack was sent in factory box. Of course, a heavy object will get damaged in transport. Here, it was banged up pretty good, bending the base, gaping hole in the box where the lift arms apparently fell out, scratches and abrasions all over the jack making it look like it was used (which it very well may have been a return). If I were Torin, I would think this is unacceptable as it looks poorly on their products. Spending the extra 80 cents or so by having the fullfillment center double box your product is worth the customer satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: jeneric

customer_reviews.title: Stopped lifting after the third lift
customer_reviews.text: Pump pump pump pump pump nothing -- it goes up to the object in this case a 2 ton trailer to change the tire and on the third lift it stopped working. I tried all the tricks on the internet to fix this and nothing works to revive this brand new week old bottle jack.
customer_reviews.author: Geo T

customer_reviews.title: Very limited use for cargo van any large vehicle
customer_reviews.text: This item barely makes the cut for my 2001 ford eco line. It maxed out tooow for any body lifting and only word when used on axels or areas at the lowest point of my van. I was able to lift the truck JUST high enough to get each wheel off so I am keeping it for tire changes. But it’s not good for anything else. Being small and light weight I figure fine. I bought the 6 to. By the way.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. Bastian

customer_reviews.title: Does not retract
customer_reviews.text: The box it arrived in not really secured and box was little tore. Haven't gotten to really use it but tested it and all works. Will update once I really use it update: used it a couple times for our motorhome. It gets the job done. Changed it from 5 star to 4 star because the only complaint I have is that the piston does not retract so you would have to kinda fight it to get it out from under the vehicle
customer_reviews.author: albert henderson

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came in a hard plastic case
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a 2017 Ram 2500 4x4. I tried the jack the truck came with and don't like it. Got this as a replacement and used it to swap some wheels. Worked great, no issues. Dropped one star on the review because it does not come in a case just the cardboard box. That won't hold up over time and I'll end up losing the jack handle because of that eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Works fine just not great for my car
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how tall this would be in comparison to my car. It's just slightly too tall to fit between the driveway and the bottom of my car where I need the jack to go. I have to use a different jack to lift the car up just another inch so this will fit. I'd recommend something else if you have a low to the ground vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Schrum

customer_reviews.title: You shoulda seen the box!
customer_reviews.text: Haha, arrived exactly expected. Box was nearly destroyed but packaged items were fine. It's a 20 ton bottle jack...what would you expect right? Purged the air thru the plug and it works great... it's not gonna lick itself and that ram will prolly never drop by itself either without weight on it, so either lick it or push on it to adjust for the next lift or for storage. Oh...and mine came with the pump handle!
customer_reviews.author: Just Mark

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money these are garbage
customer_reviews.text: Literally my first time using it and it's a piece of garbage it won't come down like it's supposed to and it won't even pump up the top part like it's supposed to so I can't even jack up my vehicle to change a tire I have a little Honda CRV piece of junk I want a refund a full refund I'll send this piece of crap back to the seller
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Nice little jack. Only weighs 4 lbs. Wish the oil bleed hole was a machine screw instead of a rubber plug. Followed the instructions, bled the air out before using, don’t think there was any, and used the jack. Works great. Nice little screw out extension on top. You can place place the jack under your object, maybe need a board or brick to get close fit, then screw out the top extension for firm grip.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: Broke on the first usage
customer_reviews.text: So, I used this one time, to jack up a 3 ton pick up truck. It extended, lifting the vehicle off the ground, then would not retract, leaving my vehicle stuck in the air. Good times were had. Amazon has already replaced this with a new one...going to give it another try because I get it, sometimes manufacturing defects happen.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: DOA. Used Torin's method and another method to bleed ...
customer_reviews.text: DOA. Used Torin's method and another method to bleed any air out and also ensured that there is sufficient amount of oil in the reservoir, but the ram will not even lift my hand. I contacted Torin, as the notice in the box instructed me to do, but they told me that I needed to go through Amazon. I do not see anywhere on Amazon's site (in my account) where I can request a return.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: One time use item!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this and first time out of the box it failed. Rotating my tyres and on the third jack it would not hold position long enough to place a jack stand. Yes it was cheap, but not cheap enough to throw it away after 20min of use. Because I purchased this while on a trip to America, it is not cost efffective to return, so just out. Anyone looking at this, save yourself a headache and keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: shane lucasburke

customer_reviews.title: its ok, for the price, but Id look elsewhere if I was going to use it a lot.
customer_reviews.text: works ok ,the handle is 2 pieces so it stores small, but you have to be careful of the pump handle coming apart as your using it. No return spring so every action is by you. I used it to replace a HF motocycle lift that the seals went in. Welded up fine, but i noticed even this 'relaxes' after a day or so of holding up the bike. (600lbs) the other annoying thing is the release knob. Its on the very base, and is small, hard to get to. hard to turn smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Slvrscoobie

customer_reviews.title: 10T jacks very sticky  to retract fully when not under load
customer_reviews.text: after removal from under the vehicle, this may clear up with use but were a real PITA the first couple times- I get the impression that the ram actually cocks in the bore a tiny bit. What I discovered that seems to ease the situation is to close the valve and put a couple pumps on the handle then the jack fully collapses easily by hand when the pressure is released. Thankfully, my Big red 20T bottle jack doesn't have this quirk!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing handle, ZERO customer service
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could tell you how well this jack works. Sadly the it arrived with a heavily damaged box but the jack was not damaged, the handle was missing. I have called the toll free number on the tool and from the website leaving messages with my name, phone number and order number. It has been crickets. I CANT USE MY BEAUTIFUL JACK!!!
customer_reviews.author: scott adams

customer_reviews.title: You will need it eventually :-)
customer_reviews.text: Solid ! Easy to use. If you have a trailer of any type.....you need one under your back seat ! I have 16 foot dual axel, with two big 570 ATVs. No prob jacking the tongue or side up. Keep a couple small pieces of 2x6 with it and you’ll have a great base in mud, and or place to distribute the pressure on frame.
customer_reviews.author: david haynes 2

customer_reviews.title: hydraulic fluid leaks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2018, stored it in my Travel RV for that "emergency". I blew out a tire in Ohio, and while retrieving the jack, from the RV, it was covered in hydraulic fluid, having soaked through the box it came in. Fortunately, the jack still worked, but made the tire change a little slippery. I will have to find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Yep, got that.

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough to pick up my house.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in jacking up a section of my house that was drastically sagging. It did the job, and I now have a level floor and the drawers don't roll open on their own anymore. If it can pick up my house, I'm sure it will work on my car and van if the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Buy a 13 dollar jack you get a 13 dollar jack................Junk
customer_reviews.text: This jack works and unlike other reviews I have no problem with it going down. I have a problem with it staying up It leeks down quite quickly. I am past the return window so no big deal it was only 13 dollars. I would suggest you look elsewhere and buy a quality jack. You do get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Media#Sicarius

customer_reviews.title: The adjustable screw on the top of the piston makes these much better suited than the cheaper versions without the screw tip
customer_reviews.text: Work exceptionally. Ordered 10 to raise a farmhouse. The adjustable screw on the top of the piston makes these much better suited than the cheaper versions without the screw tip.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Jack
customer_reviews.text: We use it for our RV, and it is really a great jack, very sturdy, a little heavy and very easy to use, We love it, in fact we just bought a second one, just in case, as we have had issues with our leveling system before, and thanks to this jack we were able to move our unit.
customer_reviews.author: mmir

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I received the jack and the original box had a lot of tape from prior shipments. The jack is missing the handle. I have called the missing parts number (1-888-448-6746) and after being on hold every time for 6 minutes the call is ended. I have left a message several times for someone to call me back, but no one has called me.
customer_reviews.author: Roger W.

customer_reviews.title: hydraulic jack arrived without handle to pump it
customer_reviews.text: this bottle jack looks ok but arrived without handle necessary to operate/ pump it. i would like to have a handle without returning the entire thing. there is no simple path to report incomplete merchandise ( a defect) so I am putting this into a review to see if AMAZON.com is paying attention
customer_reviews.author: SAMUEL ARTHUR WISE

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well helping a come-a-long lift a trailer 90 degrees to paint the bottom
customer_reviews.author: ToneDeafJunior

customer_reviews.title: Lift your home off the foundation for $28
customer_reviews.text: Lifted the floor beam with so much ease there was no resistance in the leaver. Be careful when doing this you listen for the creaking. Made the purchase because obviously the home builder 40 years ago used scrap wood and brick the shimmy up the beam. Does what its supposed to do go up and down. The down side is it's a 20ton, it requires a lot of lever action just to move an inch. Dont know the dependability but for only $28 what a deal. Time of this reveiw March 8, 2020.
customer_reviews.author: Bushwacker

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to bottle jack now, I retired my 2 ton bottle jack and use this everytime I need a bottle jack. It lifts jeeps, trucks, and vans so easy compared to my 2 ton and really it should. I have used it on a Ford E350 van, Dodge Ram 1500, Honda Pilot just to name a few and it doesn't fight to lift the load. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: When we go up we go down
customer_reviews.text: For $20, it's a really good deal. It has been extremely handy while I repair an old Toyota. I've used it close to 100 times now rebuilding my suspension and doing all sorts of repairs. After about 25 uses, I noticed a bit of oil leaking onto the piston. Not too alarming..... The red paint rubs easily so beware. But in short, it's quite strong and functional. The release button is handy to lower slowly.
customer_reviews.author: architect_review_companion

customer_reviews.title: Received with a rusty ram.
customer_reviews.text: When I went to use this jack and started to raise the ram, it had about one inch of rust on the ram cylinder. Apparently the jack had set on the shelf for some time with that amount of the ram exposed. I cleaned it up somewhat, but it still shows signs of the corrosion. I'm using it, but a little better quality check before shipping it to a customer would have made me a much happier customer.
customer_reviews.author: JOAT

customer_reviews.title: Want to try it.
customer_reviews.text: For the manufacturer: The jack looks nice but i cant use it yet as the shipped package had most of the hydraulic fluid coming out of the box. The unit dropped completely out of the box when picked up, possibly because the box was so wet. Please advise on what to re-fill with, or if you can send fluid. The device itself seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Used for house and truck
customer_reviews.text: The house I purchased had some beams that had been over-loaded and under-supported so they had sagged. I used this to raise the sag, and support the beams. Also I used this with my truck when I was doing work to life the entire engine up as well as lift the entire front end up. My other jack is only rated for 3000lbs, and could not safely lift the front of my truck up.
customer_reviews.author: Double A-Rod

customer_reviews.title: Been using this quite a few times and no issues, easy to use and easy storage.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my girlfriend in the event that she ever has a flat and I'm far away. Her car has a scissor jack but those can be tricky to manipulate and sometimes gets hard when unused for long periods. This works great for her car and fits neatly in the trunk. The locking mechanism makes the use very easy both ways with the extension handle that is just great for leverage. I'll be honest I borrow it from time to time when I'm working on my own car at home.
customer_reviews.author: Tisagh Chase

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for supporting floor joists.
customer_reviews.text: I needed 4 jacks to lift and support floor joists so I can replace some termite eatin wood. After reading the reviews I was a bit cautious and only purchased 2 and I bought 2 from Harbor Freight locally, which cost s few dollars more so I could compare them. They worked well for my purpose and I should have ordered all 4 and saved a few dollars. Like other reviews the box had some grease stains but the product worked perfectly. No issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Merkler

customer_reviews.title: Opened.  Missing Part.  Took forever to arrive
customer_reviews.text: Had been opened and one of the two handles removed from the box--the important one that opens the release valve. Will have to return immediately. This would have been a good value if it hadn't have taken forever to arrive and had arrived with all the parts. Have no idea if it would have actually worked.
customer_reviews.author: Rescueman

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality but good price
customer_reviews.text: Arrived leaking oil, release screw open. Handle is pinched to turn the pressure release screw, not notched. I don't believe I'll get much use out of this, but I have to fill it with oil before I can try it out. If it wasnt so inexpensive and perfectly tiny for my use in a mini press I'd return the thing. It will be cheaper to fill it and make a better handle.
customer_reviews.author: Account Abandoned by Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works but cheap
customer_reviews.text: Used to keep my Lawn mower wheels from going flat because they are old. It loses pressure overnight, so you use jack stands.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Yo

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Did the lifting portion of the job. I have bled it no less than six times in the couple weeks I actually used it. Doesn't hold pressure. I was lifting at a standard rate of 1⁄8" per day. By the time I came back the next day, I had lost almost all of it. Reached out to the company. Never got a response. I also have two Torin 20 ton jacks. Bled all three, at the same time, with the same procedure, laid out in the book. No issue with the 20s. I just had to take the risk of lifting the house faster than recommended, to allow for the loss of progress.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Martin

customer_reviews.title: Watch your hands
customer_reviews.text: What I like about the item is that is small and easy to carry and picks up a Jeep. What I dislike is that the paint what they say it comes off but it’s not that bad. Right now it didn’t came off the paint when I open the box. Just a little.
customer_reviews.author: Campo

customer_reviews.title: Not Big Enough to Jack Up a Car
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to jack up my Golf GTI. Unfortunately, this jack is too small to jack it up high enough to remove a while. Well, actually just big enough to remove a wheel, but not large enough to put the wheel back on once the hub has dropped a bit. Fortunately, a friend had a scissor jack in their truck we could use to put the wheel back on.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Jacked up about this jack!
customer_reviews.text: I’m jacked about this jack. It works like a champ. 20,000 lbs....no problem. It even lifted my mighty Toyota RAV4. This jack was exactly as described. I’ve had no issues, the quality is good and the jack functions exactly as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Cook

customer_reviews.title: sturdy jack
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for use on the road with my truck and side-by-side (ATV). I have had issues with flat tires in the past and plan to be prepared next time. You can spend more money, but I doubt you'd find one that works as well as this one does. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold a load
customer_reviews.text: from a tech rescue guy, Well if you want to test a unit....Put it under a load and see if it drops. I bought 4 and all failed. I returned 4 got credit for 1. Check the box you dopes. I can't stand stupidity and people taking my $$.
customer_reviews.author: KENNY

customer_reviews.title: Froze on way up, wont come back down.  Have to get bigger box to return it!
customer_reviews.text: Before using this , i tested the action and it froze one it got about 60% of its travel. upon lowering I realized it was also leaking oil all over the place. Now I have to go buy a bigger box to return it because it doesnt fit in the one it came in and it wont retract. doesnt exactly make me feel safe about using it if it has two flaws from day one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Brown

customer_reviews.title: Capable of lifting a front wheel of an F250
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my f250 in case I have to change a tire. It’s maxed out at the height for my vehicle and at its max height, I question it’s ability to hold my truck. I’ve had to add some lumber to my tire changing kit.
customer_reviews.author: L. Stillwell

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I should've read all the other one star reviews before purchasing or at least checked to see if it worked when it came in. I've had it about six months. Just tried it for the first time and it only lifts up about 2 inches. Can't return it because I've had it too long.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Bayham

customer_reviews.title: Looks used and did NOT come with a handle
customer_reviews.text: I received this jack today, the box for the Jack was covered in clear boxing tape and looked like it had been taken out of the trash. The Jack has scratches all over it, which don’t impact its functionality but my wife asked why I bought a used jack. My favorite part is that it is totally unusable since a handle was NOT included in the shipment. Yes, I could use another jack handle to raise the jack, but the release valve is very close to the ground and requires a narrow handle to clear when turning. Completely disappointed in a 20 lb paper weight. Thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nelkie

customer_reviews.title: No handle?
customer_reviews.text: The jack works good for the price, it does bleed off a little bit after a couple minuets of holding pressure (using 2 - 20 ton jacks to lift up the back of a 40,000# wheel loader), but they are hard to use without handles. I purchased 2 jacks, one came with a handle and one did not.
customer_reviews.author: Reed's Iron

customer_reviews.title: Affordable bottle jacks
customer_reviews.text: Affordable 12 ton bottle Jack's. I paid $28 something per jack Purchasing 3. Purchased to relevel 2 mobile home additions & add adjustable jack posts on new above ground rebar reinforced concrete pillars that replaced old cinderblocks. I still have two 30 ton bottle jacks to purchase to lift rear of mobile home by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Chris h.

customer_reviews.title: It lifts my car, hasn't failed, good to go.
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my slightly lifted Subaru Forester. Loaded up to around 4,000 pounds, sometimes more. It's helped me fix a flat on a trail once and I've used it to rotate my tires. It lifts high enough to get everything off the ground and onto jack stands. A little larger base would be nice, but for solid ground or pavement it's perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Chess

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy,  and affordable.
customer_reviews.text: I found out when I bought my car....no jack, who does? Well anyways, was happy to find this inexpensive handy little jack. It fits perfect in the jack compartment. It seems sturdy enough for my small 2014 Mazda. I hope I never have to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta J Slockbower

customer_reviews.title: Uplifting experience
customer_reviews.text: This jack is a beast! I bought this for our travel trailer in case of a flat. At 20-ton capacity, this will lift one side with ease. It would lift the entire trailer if necessary. The 2-piece handle gives enough length that you're not under the trailer (or truck) when lifting.
customer_reviews.author: BearBorne

customer_reviews.title: Short bottle jack, and you need to prime it before use
customer_reviews.text: This is the first bottle jack I've owned which gave me a warning that I had to prime the pump before use. Also - this pump is shorter than I expected. However once primed, it does work well and lifts the loads I need. To extend the range I place the jack on some patio blocks before the lift.
customer_reviews.author: Photographer James Falkofske

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but when you lower the jack it stops at the height of the vehicle and is wedged in place as it won’t drop any farther down without a good amount of downward force...which is hard to do when you can’t get between the car and the jack. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Amm0622

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: In spite of internet reviews saying this is the best buy out there for bottle jacks, I am disappointed. The paint and fit and finish is poorly done, I can live with that, but the jack doesn't retract back down. I followed the instructions, bled out the air, etc. It will lift, it just doesn't want to retract back down.
customer_reviews.author: cltinseattle

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: I used the jack to lift part of my houses floor joists and install new leveling posts. Worked great. It was a little difficult to collapse the jack but not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: GJ1960

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy.  Leaks Down and leaks
customer_reviews.text: They leak when it lays on its side. I know you should not use a jack as a stand or support. But a jack should hold what you jack and not leak down. If it does this at new what will it be like when it gets old! The best part I was told by Torin , This is normal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert West

customer_reviews.title: Decent bottle jack for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Solid little bottle jack. The arm to pump the jack up is 2 pieces and a little cumbersome but does the job. The paint as other reviews have stated was already coming off in the box. Time will tell how well constructed it is.
customer_reviews.author: MB3

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to apply warranty to new registration of products
customer_reviews.text: Been using Torin for a few years niw and have always brrn hsppy with operations. Wish registeringvsnd getting service parts under wstrantu was as nice. That needs to be improved drastically and mail in forms included.
customer_reviews.author: REV. L

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The box I received was missing part of the handle and had a totally different address in a different state on it the jack flakes red paint on your hands and didn’t work as well as a cheap harbor freight bottle jack
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Than Sissor Jack
customer_reviews.text: Bottle Jacks are always better than sissor jacks becuse of much easier they are to use and their increase load capacity. Considering they cosr about the same I would recomend this to any one need a new small car jack.
customer_reviews.author: chasen

customer_reviews.title: The facts about this
customer_reviews.text: Came poorly packaged, missing parts and does not work. Returning. Then ordered a second one that came with more parts in the box. That one did work to lift a sidewalk, which was the intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons Customers

customer_reviews.title: Nice bottle jack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to jack up my dual-axle camper to change tires. Did a great job and lifted the entire side of the camper with no problems. You have to be very careful when letting off the pressure with a heavy load on it, but that's the case with any bottle jack. It seems well made. I will only be using it for occasional use, so I don't know how it would stand up to excessive use. However, I was very pleased with my purchase as it did the job that I needed it for.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mast

customer_reviews.title: Money well spend
customer_reviews.text: OUTSTANDING VALUE FOR THE MONEY SPENT. lifted the rear corner of my holiday rambler imperial diesel pusher bus with ease. Left it sit with that load overnight and no bleed off. Compact size makes it easy to carry along on the road. In my opinion I could not justify spending more than when this jack has proven to do the job well for all the more I will need to use it AND THEY SHIPPED IT FAST
customer_reviews.author: LIBERTY SMITH

customer_reviews.title: For emergency back up use only
customer_reviews.text: Given the small volume, light weight and cheap price, it is great to have in the car for emergency. But if you want to use it as primary, don’t. It doesn’t have enough travel, the jack won’t retract all the way after a few uses.
customer_reviews.author: E.L.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for lifted trucks
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2015 Chevrolet Silverado with a 6-inch Lift and 35 inch tires. This is the cheapest most reliable and portable Jack for the job. It will lift my truck enough to change the tire without any blocks. I would also recommend the Torin 6-ton Jack's if you have the same setup on your truck.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Watched a youtube video where this was recommended for lifting a sunken patio slab
customer_reviews.text: Worked awesome! Concrete is heavy but no match for this jack. Dug it out, lifted it and filled with cement and now the patio is looking as good as new. Was a tripping hazard but this fixed it right up!
customer_reviews.author: Jack White

customer_reviews.title: Height is from floor up
customer_reviews.text: The product description says Lifting range of 9-18 inches. Without a wooden block underneath It got to 18 inches and it wouldn’t lift. With the wooden block it got to 14 inches and still woudn’t lift. Also keep in mind 9 - 18 inch figure is from ground up not the length of the hydraulic ram. Oil also started spilling out for Of the thing. It’s just no comparison to the stock Toyota bottle jack.
customer_reviews.author: o.n

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than I expected but lifts my 4" lifted 94 F150 on 33x12.5's perfectly fine without issue. Look forward to never having to use it, but will be there when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: not happy
customer_reviews.text: did not have opportunity to use the jack even though i received it and price and features looked good because the item arrived used not new as advertised...sold by amazon llc.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: A GOOD COMPACT RED JACK
customer_reviews.text: SMALL COMPACT BOLTS RIGHT INSIDE THE ENGINE COMPARTMENT AND IVE USED IT OUNCE AND IT WORKED PERFECT . THE TRUCK I JACKED UP WAS A FULL SIZE BRONCO AND IT DID IT WITH EASY . LITTLE EFFORT ON MY PART . WELL MADE FELLS SOLID . LOOKS GOOD ALL RED TOO . 9/10 EASY
customer_reviews.author: brian mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I finally had to use it.... ...
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to use it..... I had almost 34,000 pounds on my set of drive axles when a tire blew up on my way out of a parking lot... It seemed to lift and hold the weight of my fully loaded truck effortlessly while I spent an hour and a half peeling off the old tire and beating on the spare.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Benton

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 6 ton model. I followed the 1st time before use instructions. I had also noticed from shipping that some hydraulic oil had leaked out on the box that it came in, so I bought some and filled it and purged the air. It worked great for my truck. Good 6 ton bottle jack.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. RT

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: I used them for months jacking up a heavy floor back into place. Never failed, and I bought several of them. No leaks, have been used a lot with zero problems.
customer_reviews.author: kent dubose

customer_reviews.title: Cheap... but it works.
customer_reviews.text: The product works alright, but I have to say.. could they make it any cheaper? The handle on the jack itself is about the thickness of a pencil, and the crank handle is two sections of steel pipe flattened in a press slightly and little more. Still, it all works, and I do appreciate the low price for something that I won't use more than once or twice per year. PS.. if it doesn't seem to work right out of the box, read the instructions: You have to bleed the air out first.
customer_reviews.author: sixtiesdad

customer_reviews.title: Purchased a pair of these to repair support posts in ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a pair of these to repair support posts in a 1898 produce barn. Only got one post r/r before they both failed.
customer_reviews.author: -Seth, Columbia Gorge

customer_reviews.title: Product does not work on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very low on oil (packaging is dry) and product will not lift after an oil top-off and days of attempting to bleed. The entire pump assembly moves extremely easily and I can't hear any oil movement, which leaves me feeling that the pump assembly is junk or not adjusted correctly. I shouldn't have to troubleshoot a product out of the box, regardless of how cheap it's price point is.
customer_reviews.author: Trustin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Works well for me. Only worry that in the most high mode it is not holding pressure, it lift down for 1cm under the pressure. Great value for sure. I used it to lift some metal bath tubes and old bathroom. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Alex Yakauleu

product_meta.title: BIG RED T92003B Torin Hydraulic Welded Bottle Jack, 20 Ton (40,000 lb) Capacity, Red
product_meta.description: Size:20 TonThe Torin BIG RED T92003B hydraulic bottle jack is designed for residential and commercial use. It is industrial welded and engineered using a drop forged alloyed steel construction that is ideal for quality and durability. The inner/outer welded structure and steel construction will keep your bottle jack leak-free and give it an overall stronger build. The fully welded structure is designed for hard-hitting commercial use, making large loads easy to lift. A wide, rugged base adds stability and strength. The lifting range is 9-1/2" to 17-3/4" with a 20 ton (40,000 lb) capacity. It features a high-quality glide-action pressure pump designed to lift with minimal muscle and effort and has an integrated built-in oil-bypass and overload valve that protects the hydraulic system from extending beyond its travel limits. Hydraulics are powered with a high-quality oil, which offers better corrosion resistance and high/low temperature flexibility, allowing the unit to operate at temperatures between 40 degrees Fahrenheit and 105 degrees Fahrenheit. Piston ram utilizes a Y-style polyurethane sealing ring with backup ring, preventing the load from falling slowly. This powerful bottle jack is ideal for lifting cars, trucks, SUVs, farm vehicles, heavy-duty machinery and industrial equipment. It can also be used for military applications, agricultural and industrial environments where the equipment receives heavier abuse. This unit is 100% factory tested for reliability and safety to meet and comply with ASME PASE safety standards. Includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: Hydraulic bottle jack designed for residential and commercial use; Serrated, heat treated saddle provides generous lifting area and secure grip
Features a lifting range of 9-1/2" to 17-3/4" with a 20 ton (40,000 lb) capacity; Adjustable screw top extension adds versatility
Engineered using a drop forged alloyed steel construction for quality and durability; Inner/outer welded structure delivers leak-free performance
Glide-action pressure pump is designed to lift with minimal effort; Integrated built-in oil-bypass and overload valve that protects the hydraulic system from extending beyond limits
Meets ASME PASE safety standards and includes a limited 1 year manufacturer warranty
